name: sfchronicle
text:
On Saturday night, the lefty who spent 11 seasons in orange and black makes his first appearance against San Francisco as the Diamondbacks and Giants play the second game of a four-game series in China Basin.

https://t.co/4nwzXyTDj0

name: sfchronicle
text:
A review of Yolo County‚Äôs mass notification system found that voice calls notifying people about the LNU Complex did not go through to residents.

 "It appears the calls registered as spam or robocalls and were blocked," a county spokeswoman said. https://t.co/jtFPzJJwoy

name: sfchronicle
text: JUST IN: The fast-growing Creek Fire in Fresno County has trapped about 1,000 people near Mammoth Pool reservoir. Unable to evacuate, they've been told to shelter in place and to jump in the reservoir if necessary. https://t.co/pTZH3PVFYa

name: sfchronicle
text:
In the A‚Äôs 8-4 win over the Padres, Sean Manaea turned up the heat with his fastball. In five innings against a San Diego lineup leading the MLB in runs, Manaea allowed one run on four hits with five strikeouts.

https://t.co/kjK2e6hUW9

name: sfchronicle
text: Track the Creek Fire and the rest of the wildfires burning across California on our interactive map: https://t.co/vLELppTGqh

name: sfchronicle
text: California‚Äôs power grid operator says rolling blackouts are likely on Saturday amid a scorching heat wave and increased power demand. It is stressing residents to conserve energy to relieve stress on the grid. https://t.co/jvdZVMzaxF

name: sfchronicle
text:
The Bay Area could see rotating power outages today as the state electricity grid struggles to keep up with demand due to air conditioning in the intense heat. Temperatures are expected to get even hotter Sunday.

https://t.co/vATSqULZYz

name: sfchronicle
text:
Creek Fire Update: About 150 people were trapped near Mammoth Pool Reservoir, according to the Madera County Sheriff, and ten were injured. Earlier, a Forest Service spokesman had said that as many as 1,000 people were sheltering there. 

https://t.co/XsIVZtSqNP

name: sfchronicle
text:
PG&E announced plans to potentially cut power on Monday and Tuesday,  the first outage of its kind for this fire season.

Seventeen counties could be affected, PG&E said ‚Äî including Napa and Sonoma.

name: sfchronicle
text: Fresno fire officials tweeted that fire personnel were on the scene of a ‚Äúmulti-casualty incident receiving patients injured by the Creek Fire.‚Äù Dozens of injured were being flown to the Fresno airport, officials said. https://t.co/lxAezGoIvu

name: sfchronicle
text:
Creek Fire Update: Dozens of people injured in the fire have been airlifted to Fresno hospitals. The blaze is 0% contained and is tearing through the rugged, forested foothills of eastern Fresno County.

https://t.co/AVsOUVmTzH

name: sfchronicle
text:
The California National Guard assisting in rescue of dozens of Creek Fire evacuees. A helicopter was airlifting people from the Creek Fire area late Saturday night, according to CalGuard officials. 

https://t.co/i8wmkMtNoe

text: Some odds and ends of the non-Madison Bumgarner portion of the Giants‚Äô 4-3 win over Arizona at Oracle Park on Saturday night: https://t.co/tFcO90wwwS

name: sfchronicle
text: Creek Fire Update: Fresno fire officials said 63 people had been rescued by military helicopters and taken to the Fresno Airport. Two were ‚Äúseverely injured,‚Äù 10 were ‚Äúmoderately injured,‚Äù and 51 sustained minor or no injuries, Fresno fire officials said. https://t.co/9UDNUIY88l

name: sfchronicle
text: With the pandemic and a slew of new health and safety mandates, the experience of eating out has become an even more tensely choreographed ballet among diners, chefs and staff. What‚Äôs acceptable ‚Äî and what‚Äôs not ‚Äî has changed. https://t.co/AyXbwaE4xL

text: A helicopter scan for radioactivity at San Francisco‚Äôs former bases had limited value. The city relied on it anyway. https://t.co/PRGaZoXRot

name: sfchronicle
text: In a California landscape defined ‚Äî and divided ‚Äî by water, a single issue unites the people who live here: digging in against the tunnel. https://t.co/fUxZEx0JmS

name: sfchronicle
text: The Throughline has been asking futurists and academics to show us what tomorrow will look like. Now we‚Äôre turning to children to give us a peek into the future of playgrounds, school and spending time together. https://t.co/S1p777Xnpl

name: sfchronicle
text:
After years of failed attempts and vociferous opposition, California lawmakers adopted a measure to grant nurse practitioners the ability to practice without doctor supervision. The bill now heads to Gov. Gavin Newsom for consideration.

https://t.co/dQ0Gdp14mU
